passage.title: He wants your cap
passage.paragraph: Tom goes home at five o'clock. He gets on a bus. A mother with her little son sit nearby. Suddenly the boy begins to cry. His mother tries her best to make the boy stop crying. But the boy will not do so.
At last Tom says angrily, "Oh, how the boy cries! Why don't you give him what he wants?"
"I will if I can," answers the mother quietly. "But he wants your cap."
